alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:15PM EST until January 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill affecting Franklin County. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillhouse Hollow Road floods. At 11.0 feet, Schoolhouse Road floods. At 12.0 feet, North Scruggs Lane floods near Elkhorn Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.1 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 09/24/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
